project.description: I made CSS, HTML, Javascript and PHP on Carl 'Djinn' Lewis portfolio, a wordpress instance.
The Global Lives Project is an Art Installation website I maintain and improve upon as needed.
Norse is focused on internet security. I made CSS, HTML, Javascript and a secure WordPress site.
For this release I made CSS, HTML, modified the Javascript and used the jQuery library.
For this release I made changes to the CSS, HTML, modified the Javascript and used the jQuery library.
I made CSS, HTML, modified the Javascript and used the jQuery and Angular JS libraries. The map was an ongoing and evolving project.
I made CSS, HTML, modified the Javascript and used the jQuery library. The initial map was not fit for production.
is a site based on the UX 2014 health initiative. I made CSS, HTML, and used the jQuery library and Bootstrap to build initial design UIs.
A company researching biometrics for educational institutions and pharmaceutical companies - funded by Kaiser.
is a functional area. I made the CSS, HTML, and used jQuery. I also helped to design the functionality.
is built to show the personal side of the company. I built the CSS, HTML and jQuery for the new section after being given mocks.
The idea behind the bazaar is to sell the "props" used in the catalog. I built the CSS, HTML and javascript for this area.
is redesigned to match the catalog. Ideas from the design were transformed by me into CSS, HTML and Javascript.
is a site started by the Serena and Lily foundation. It uses a form submitting to an external site, and has my CSS, HTML and jQuery.
is a project where I was provided a mock to work from, then created CSS, HTML and javascript to make a new site.
I was assigned the task of remaking the site to modernize it. I changed the CSS, HTML and structure of the pages.
was designed with the intent of empowering employees. I made the initial CSS, HTML, and jQuery and helped out with code.
is a site where I was provided a mock home page, from which I made the CSS and HTML. I used grids to build the pages.
is designed as a new popover for the search results page. I made the HTML and CSS for it to match the mock.
is designed to accept community submissions of designs. I made the CSS, HTML and javascript for this dynamic area.
are in a flow of CSS, HTML, Javascript and SMARTY templates to provide information to help find a matching doctor.
is designed to give the customer details on Carriers and Plans. The pages are SMARTY templates to insert CMS data.
is designed with the intent of educating customers about what health care means and what is to be looked for in different health care insurance plans.
I negotiated feasibility of the pages with the programmers and worked directly with the marketing team and designers.
I created this entire site from scratch for RealtyTrac.com during January and February of 2006.
is a site created to promote and provide information on the women's bicycle racing team Pacific Crush.
is a site for companies to find new employees specializing in a field. At launch I made the HTML, CSS and javascript as dynamic as possible,
is a website promoting environmentally conscious grocery bags. I mirrored the client's real-world products and designed a site for the sale of the bags.
is a site for Kerrie to advertise herself and show demos of her work. I made several design and logo concepts.
is a website I made the base HTML and CSS for into a table-less and semantic form. I then passed on the HTML to the owner, who wanted to learn to do HTML herself.
was a wedding website promoting their joining. It featured photos of the couple, a guestbook, and wedding information.
is a project for someone who asked me to organize the periodicals and books in his library (10k+), so I made the search engine and website in PHP.
is a ThinkQuest project conveying a high-level understanding of several forms of Japanese art. The site received a gold medal.
wanted a web presence, so in 2001 he hired me to create a website. The site has been modified but the CSS, HTML and color scheme I used remain unchanged.
is a blog site I set up and maintained on a local machine. The site was targeted at my friends who talked a lot about Web Dev and cooking.
